javadoc:
Class to hold information about a dockable component with respect to its position within the
 windowing system.  It also holds identification information about the provider so that its
 location can be reused when the provider is re-opened.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: XML Constructor!!!!!

params.name: show
params.comment: whether or not the component is showing.

methods.javadoc: Returns the componentNode containing this placeholder.
methods.name: getNode
methods.comment: Returns the componentNode containing this placeholder.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the componentNode containing this placeholder
@param node the component node containing this placeholder.
methods.name: setNode
methods.comment: Sets the componentNode containing this placeholder

params.name: node
params.comment: the component node containing this placeholder.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the component is not hidden.
methods.name: isShowing
methods.comment: Returns true if the component is not hidden.

methods.name: wantsToBeShowing
methods.comment:
True signals that the showing state of the placeholder is true.  This is used to re-show
 providers after restoring from XML.

return.comment: True signals that the showing state of the placeholder is true

methods.javadoc:
Call to signal that this placeholder is not being used.  This is needed when placeholders
 are restored from XML as being visible, but then no provider can be found for them.
methods.name: reset
methods.comment:
Call to signal that this placeholder is not being used.  This is needed when placeholders
 are restored from XML as being visible, but then no provider can be found for them.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the active state.
@param doShow true to show the component, false to hide it.
methods.name: show
methods.comment: Sets the active state.

params.name: doShow
params.comment: true to show the component, false to hide it.

methods.javadoc: Requests focus for the component associated with this placeholder.
methods.name: requestFocus
methods.comment: Requests focus for the component associated with this placeholder.

methods.javadoc:
Hides the component associated with this placeholder and notifies the provider that
 the component has been hidden.
methods.name: close
methods.comment:
Hides the component associated with this placeholder and notifies the provider that
 the component has been hidden.

methods.javadoc: Returns a Dockable component that wraps the component for this placeholder.
methods.name: getComponent
methods.comment: Returns a Dockable component that wraps the component for this placeholder.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the title for this component.
@return the title for this component.
methods.name: getTitle
methods.comment: Returns the title for this component.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the subtitle for the component
@return the subtitle for the component
methods.name: getSubTitle
methods.comment: Returns the subtitle for the component

methods.javadoc:
The text for display on the tab of a tabbed component.
@return The text for display on the tab of a tabbed component.
methods.name: getTabText
methods.comment: The text for display on the tab of a tabbed component.

return.comment: The text for display on the tab of a tabbed component.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of this component.
@return the name of this component.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns the name of this component.

methods.javadoc: Returns the owner for the component.
methods.name: getOwner
methods.comment: Returns the owner for the component.

methods.javadoc: Returns the component associated with this placeholder.
methods.name: getProviderComponent
methods.comment: Returns the component associated with this placeholder.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this placeholder's component is currently in a tabbed pane with other components.
methods.name: isStacked
methods.comment: Returns true if this placeholder's component is currently in a tabbed pane with other components.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this placeholder is currently associated with a component. If it is not,
 then it exists as a place holder.
methods.name: hasProvider
methods.comment:
Returns true if this placeholder is currently associated with a component. If it is not,
 then it exists as a place holder.

methods.javadoc: Sets the component provider for this placeholder.
methods.name: setProvider
methods.comment: Sets the component provider for this placeholder.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the component provider for this placeholder.
@return the component provider for this placeholder.
methods.name: getProvider
methods.comment: Returns the component provider for this placeholder.

return.comment: the component provider for this placeholder.

methods.javadoc:
Adds an action to this component
@param action the action to be added.
methods.name: addAction
methods.comment: Adds an action to this component

methods.javadoc:
Removes an action from this component
@param action the action to be removed.
methods.name: removeAction
methods.comment: Removes an action from this component

methods.javadoc: Updates local actions for providers
methods.name: contextChanged
methods.comment: Updates local actions for providers

methods.javadoc: Return iterator over all the local actions defined for this component.
methods.name: getActions
methods.comment: Return iterator over all the local actions defined for this component.

methods.javadoc: notifies the node that this component has focus.
methods.name: setSelected
methods.comment: notifies the node that this component has focus.

methods.javadoc: Signals to use the GUI to make this provider stand out from the rest.
methods.name: emphasize
methods.comment: Signals to use the GUI to make this provider stand out from the rest.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the full title for this component (title + subtitle)
@return the full title for this component (title + subtitle)
methods.name: getFullTitle
methods.comment: Returns the full title for this component (title + subtitle)

return.comment: the full title for this component (title + subtitle)

name: ComponentPlaceholder
comment:
Class to hold information about a dockable component with respect to its position within the
 windowing system.  It also holds identification information about the provider so that its
 location can be reused when the provider is re-opened.

fields.javadoc: Set to a default value if this class' provider is not duplicatable; a unique value otherwise
fields.name: instanceID
fields.comment: Set to a default value if this class' provider is not duplicatable; a unique value otherwise
